The current maxim is that the Internet knows everything about you. Do you think the Internet is invading your privacy

Internet , one of the most successfull development of this modern era which made our work easier and comfortable whether in respect of travel, job ,mairrage, IT's, communication etc and we are still blaming it . Can you imagine a life without internet ? It seems as if one is blocked in web's of spider and one has to apply extra effort to come out of it . Its the internet which  made it so easy and fast . There are so many examples lets take one suppose one need a job than he/she has not to go evey door and apply, its the internet through which one can upload all his /her relevalent details and make it global visual . Thus in short time one accesses huge number of recruiters . But still there is blame that its invading one's privacy . I don't think its fully correct beside looking to its disadvantage why not to look at its advantages. Its a natural law that every action has two sides positive or negative .  Then why to go on negative side ? Even when a coin is tossed it has either head or tail .

Similarly if one is  looking for bride or groom for mairrage  there are several sites lets take one for example shadi.com . By simply loading your details you can access huge number of profiles world wide and then accodingly you filter them for mairrage .  See how  easy it is , how a chunk of work reduced to small one in short time. Every thing is in ones control a click away . 

Lastly i would say it's not good to just blame i agree that to certain extent internet invades one's privacy but we can not hold it and sit down we must look to its positive side that how advantageous it is for our daily lives. How fast and easy our life has been. We  know that evey invention has its advantages and disadvantages but its human tendany to use its positive side. Sometimes we need to face its negative side but we are menatlly prepared and capable enough to tackel it in comparision to its advantages . We must not hold and sit down .
